definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: You should keep these emotional stimulators in a place where you can see them.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把這些能激勵自己的事物放在看得見的地方。

sentences.english: Can you see what I see?
sentences.chinese: 你能看得見我看見的嗎？

sentences.english: Six practical function of living, Special query Voltage and electric quantity, saving power visible.
sentences.chinese: 六大生活實用功能，特設電壓電量查詢，省電看得見。

sentences.english: Time is treated as if it were something almost tangible.
sentences.chinese: 對待時間簡直就像它是看得見，摸得着的東西一樣。

sentences.english: They can be seen after installed into the car.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這些衝壓件在安裝入汽車之後還能看得見。

sentences.english: It has made a super stealth plane that cannot be seen or heard by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 它製造了沒人看得見或者聽得見的超級隱形飛機。

sentences.english: In the Paradiso, ideas and feelings are visible.
sentences.chinese: 在天堂，想法和心情是可以看得見。

sentences.english: The paint has visible gestures, it is human, it moves.
sentences.chinese: 畫有看得見的姿態，它是人性的，是靈動的。

sentences.english: From the coast of Mazu, you can actually see the villager walking on the opposite side.
sentences.chinese: 從馬祖的海岸，你其實看得見對面行走的鄉親。

sentences.english: He could see down the plughole, so the sun must have shone.
sentences.chinese: 排水孔下面也看得見，一定是太陽光顧過。

sentences.english: Five, out of the 100 billion galaxies, with the naked eye.
sentences.chinese: 在一千億個星系中，用肉眼看得見五個。

sentences.english: Pants should be fitted, but free of visible panty lines.
sentences.chinese: 褲子要稱身，然而不要看得見線頭。

sentences.english: I can see through the gate of that house the gardener digging the ground.
sentences.chinese: 從一家門口，我看得見一個園丁在那裏掘地。

sentences.english: How many flags can you see?
The coastguard cottages had a splendid view overlooking the bay.
sentences.chinese: 在海岸警衛員的小屋正好可以看得見海灣壯麗的景色。

sentences.english: I could see a shining object in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我看得見空中的發光物。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
